This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park office. The Supply Planner is responsible for end-to-end supply chain planning and product availability for a portfolio of AR/VR products, accessories and SKUs. Is accountable for supply chain key performance indicators (KPI) associated with the assigned product portfolio.

Experience presenting and influencing senior management.
Experience in a startup/small-team entrepreneurial environment.

University BS or MS in supply chain or related field.

SUPPLY PLANNER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Single point of contact for supply planning and product availability for the items in their portfolio. Develops tactical, capacity/material constrained production plans to fulfill the requirements created in the Demand Plan.
Understands multi-channel demand signals for the products in the assigned portfolios and provides actionable recommendations to respond/adjust trends (e-commerce, retail, enterprise, non-revenue).
Creates and maintains inventory plans for finished goods and accessories across regional DCs considering operational and fulfillment service policies, financial targets and cost-effective transportation considerations.
Owns the weekly S&OP process for assigned product portfolios, including leading the meetings and providing information to cross functional teams to support supply and demand planning objectives.
Responsible for creating, communicating and monitoring detailed requested Ship Plans at the contract manufacturing sites (forecast, commits, build plans, PO creation, E&O planning).
Partners with Contract Manufacturing Operations to ensure that site capacities are properly modeled and optimized across the network in meeting customer demand.
Responsible for the identification and resolution of supply issues, including communication, escalation and coordination of resolution.
Develops and manages inbound and outbound priorities, allocations, and backlog resolution.
Is accountable for supply chain key performance indicators (KPI) associated with the assigned product portfolio.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience participating and running S&OP meetings and processes.
Experience with ERP systems (specifically regarding planning, order management, allocations, and fulfillment).
Expert in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience retrieving insights/reports from data portals (Tableau, Business Intelligence hubs).
Experience presenting and influencing senior management.
Experience in a startup/small-team entrepreneurial environment.
Experience driving decision making through fact-based analysis and rationale.
Experience prioritizing and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
University BS or MS in supply chain or related field.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Sense of urgency, accuracy, and follow-through.
4+ years’ experience in relevant Supply Planning roles, preferably in Consumer Electronics.
Certification in materials management/supply chain (e.g., APICS) is preferred.
